page.title: 13An elderly person's view
page.content: Mr Pickering aged 69 yrs has lived in Brigstock for 35 years. Born in Kettering and married for 47 years he has three children: Alison is working in Paris, David in Cornwall and Lesley lives in the village. He worked in British Steel and was made redundant in 1980. His house was converted from a wheelwright's barn. He says that village life has changed during the past 35 years. There are no cows in the street, but much more heavy traffic. Years ago the Sunday joint was taken and cooked in the local bakehouse while they were in church and collected afterwards. While he was working it was heartwarming to see the {Corby Candle}glowing in the night sky. He reads the Daily Express and the local {Evening Telegraph.}
